comment: He is a great professor. He is very knowledgeable and the lectures are interesting. Class isn't mandatory but I would go for the lectures. There is a quiz and discussion post every week but they aren't hard. There are 4 inperson test and the study guided he gives are questions from the test. There is one easy paper at the end of the semester.

Great professor, very sweet and caring. You can tell he is very passionate about what he is teaching and he genuinely wants his students to learn and succeed. You can argue about test questions and get points back if he agrees that a question was confusing. He breaks up the essay into sections and lets you submit each section for review.
You can tell he really cares about his students. His class is interesting and he gives plenty of time for big assignments. One of the best teachers I have ever had.

Great guy. Also involved on Psy Chi, so kiss up a little. Hes fun and interesting to listen to. I made an A and didnt feel like it required more work than one should expect in an upper level course. Take him if you can.

He is an amazing person. I had him for an internship class, he wants you to learn. He won't be hard on any grading. You can talk to him anytime and he will work with you if you are struggling. An amazing person. We have one paper and presentation for class and you have all semester to work on it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Great professor. Very funny, caring , & empathetic. Isn't out to make your school life horrific. Just an overall great dude. Do your reading, Show up to class, & Pass. No extra credit or grade bumps (you shouldn't need it anyways). Get ready to write A LOT & FAST on exams for short answers though!!

Can't say enough good things about Niederjohn. So helpful, so relatable, so chill. I wish I would've taken more of his classes. Participation is a must, so is showing up. Small assignments every week and a 12 pg paper and 12 min presentation at the end, but he breaks it all up to make things as stress free as possible. TAKE HIM!

The man is GREAT I don't see how you can really have a complaint about him. If you have the chance, take him. I took him two semesters in a row. He's a relaxed guy, not a lot of work at all a few tests and a paper due and the end of the semester.

Dr. Niederjohn is a great professor! Abnormal psych is interesting and he has great stories and a lot of experience. He is a reserved guy but he is very funny, nice, and always willing to answer questions. I recommend him 100% and will take him again if the chance arises!

I took Dr. Niederjohn for Theories of personality, Senior seminar, and I also did an internship with him. He is an amazing guy!! He is willing to help in any way possible. He would read your 15 page paper before the due date.  He knows his stuff. I would highly recommend him.

This is a great class! I really enjoyed how Dr. Niederjohn taught the course. He really tries to keep you thinking. He has a quirky sense of humor that made me laugh a lot. I did have to read the text but he also posts power points. The tests aren't super hard but they aren't really easy either. Just make sure to attend class and take notes!

This class wasn't really what I expected. It's somewhat of a repeat of Intro and Lifespan Development, but Dr. Niederjohn makes all of the material interesting. Tests are 20 multiple choice and 5 short answers. Questions come from powerpoints and lectures. Powerpoints are posted on D2L. Attendance is not mandatory. Take him!

I had Niederjohn for Abnormal Psychology. He's pretty funny just as a character, and the material is interesting and straightforward. 3 tests and a paper, though the last test threw me for a loop and almost compromised my A, so make sure you're prepared (easy enough to do). Absolutely fair class.

Dr. Niederjohn is very laid back and cool. Gives TONS of opportunities to make an A in this class. 10 discussion posts and reading reactions available thru-out but only grades 5. Attendance is not required, but will definitely help your grade. If you write a reading reaction, you have to be present for that week to get points for it. Easy A class.

Dr. Niederjohn is a great professor and very cute. Take him if you can! His class consists of 3 exams (20-mtpl choice/5-short essay) and a paper. Attendance is not mandatory, but you will learn a lot more if you attend class!
He is great, helpful, really interesting to listen to. Loved him for senior seminar and abnormal

He is AWESOME! I did not have to go to class. You must read the book though. His tests are 25 multiple choice and 5 of 8 short answer. His Study guides are really good. Some of the questions are on the test. I LOVED his class.

All i can say is Dudes the man. He teaches in a way thats easy to understand. His tests are 20 multiple choice and pick 5 of 7 short answers. He grades fairly. One big paper but it's due at the very end. If I can make an A with this guy, anyone can.

This is a CLINICAL psyc class that might as well be Abnormal. Tons of reading from book & articles: 11 reaction papers, 2 BIG papers, 3 tests. Overall, a lot of work and he is not an easy grader. I got my first B on a paper ever. Tests are based on the book but are very specific & hard to study for. He doesn't narrow it down. Study, Study, Study!

Awesome class! The professor is great. He knows what he's talking about. I wrote my first APA paper in his class and he helped me so much. I got an A on it because of him. His tests are right from the book and study guides. His class is easy if you read the material and do the work.
Teacher knows his material and is very helpful. His test are very easy but there is a large research paper that is just time consuming
